executive_summary: The Golf Equipment Store industry has experienced strong demand from health-conscious consumers as sports participation has increased, requiring more athletic apparel, footwear, and other sporting goods for their fitness regimens. Further, during the pandemic and immediate aftermath golf was permissible as it met social distancing and other health and safety mandates, benefitting the industry. The industry has equally benefited from consolidation, which has enabled large-scale retailers to bypass sporting wholesalers, securing supply contracts directly with manufacturers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pandemic conditions lead to pent-up demand and build industry momentum
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic created an opportune increase in disposable income, free time and demand for outdoor activities, positively affecting the Golf Equipment Stores industry. As many traditional entertainment options were restricted or closed during most of 2020, consumers' interest in outdoor activities surged in the following years.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Golf stores adapt to changing industry landscape
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Due to increasing competition from other industry operators and mass merchandisers, many operators have engaged in merger and acquisition activity to bolster revenue. While the pandemic positively affected industry revenue growth, the shift toward online shopping has been a significant influence on golf stores.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Substitutes begin to siphon away demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As entertainment options are fully open and concerns regarding the pandemic fully dissipate, industry operators will likely experience increased challenges regarding sustaining consumer interest in golf. This dynamic will be exacerbated by declining per capita disposable income.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry growth comes with its expenses
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Upward trends in sports participation are slated to drive demand for sporting goods. Growth in the sports participation rate will lead to more individuals requiring industry products.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry retail golf equipment to consumers, excluding shoes. This industry does not include stores within golf courses and country clubs.

threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: Inclines in the sports participation rate, even despite disruption during the pandemic, have benefited golf equipment stores as demand stayed consistently high.
The industry has benefited from more health-conscious individuals requiring golf equipment during the current period.
The Golf Equipment Stores industry does not typically receive any specific government assistance. The industry does receive some indirect assistance from various industry associations.
Product innovations in material design and smart golf technology have aided industry enterprises as they diversify their offerings and cater to new markets.
While consolidation activity has occurred via mergers and acquisitions, overall the amount of industry enterprises has inclined.
Price competition has intensified as golf equipment stores not only compete with one another, but also must account for substitute sporting apparel and other activities.

products_and_services.product_description: Golf clubs are the most quintessential component of golf equipment stores, and compared to other product segments are also the most expensive, as a result they account for the most revenue industry out of all industry products.

One of the most crucial product offerings is apparel and other golf wearables, these range from bags to footwear to other clothing and training aids. This product segment has been growing to account for more industry revenue, in part due to the building popularity of golf tech accessories, for example, launch monitors, swing analyzers and GPS wearables, that hobbyists now demand.

The rise of niche and boutique products that integrate sustainable materials, customization, technology and innovative designs has helped enterprises cater to a wider and simultaneously more diverse audience. DEMAND FOR GOLF BALLS AND TEES REVOLVES AROUND NECESSITY AND REPEAT CUSTOMERS While golf balls and tees are inexpensive, most golfers must make repeat purchases of tees and balls, which contributes to this products segment's health, together accounting for over a third of industry revenue. The latest innovations including lighter and new materials have injected freshness into this product category. Additionally, the boom in e-commerce and online retail sales has made procurement accessible.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand from Consumers Between 45 and 64 Has Increased Due to Rising Disposable Income
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This age range accounts for over a third of total industry revenue, which can be primarily attributed to the fact that this demographic includes adults with stable income levels and careers. Golf is a popular pastime for business professionals; this trend bodes well for the industry. Parents may encourage their children to engage in recreational athletic activity, and adult consumers seek ways to maintain fitness as they age.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand from Consumers Under 44 Has Grown Due to More Health-Conscious Individuals and Families
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Examples of sporting activities undertaken by households with children include camping and fishing, suggesting that parents become more active as their children age.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Consumers Over 65 Represent a Small But Vital Customer Group
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Fluctuations in disposable income levels also influence household participation in sports. For instance, high disposable income levels may encourage more families to procure golf equipment rather than rent or buy secondhand.

business_locations.location_description: The image shows a bar chart with the number of business locations for Golf Equipment Stores in the US over different years. The data shows that the number of business locations has remained relatively steady around 8,000 over the years from 2012 to 2024 (projected).

basis_points.basis_title: Consolidation activity via mergers and acquisitions
basis_points.basis_description: While consolidation activity has occurred via mergers and acquisitions, overall the amount of industry enterprises has inclined.
Simultaneously to new entrants flooding the field, prominent companies have acquired smaller retailers in order to gain an economy of scope.
Price competition has intensified as golf equipment stores not only compete with one another, but also must account for substitute sporting apparel and other activities.
By extension industry profitability has stagnated.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs are the Most Significant Expense for Industry Enterprises
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs represent the largest cost components for industry operators, accounting for an estimated 54.9% of revenue in 2024, slightly up from 54.6% in 2019.
Wage costs account for an estimated 12.0% of industry revenue in 2024. Wages as a share of industry revenue have increased as the value of industry wages has risen in line with increased demand.
Golf Equipment Stores industry profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is estimated to represent 2.8% of industry revenue in 2024, remaining steady since 2019.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low Rate of New Patent Technologies
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Due to the discretionary nature of products, demand is influenced by disposable income.
Consumers are price-conscious; by extension, purchasing sporting goods depends on the income level at their disposal.
Different sports' popularity and participation rates affected demand for sporting goods and equipment.
Trends in sports participation are driven by the perceived health benefits associated with various sports, which has constrained industry revenue volatility.
